title: The 7 Best High Frequency Wands to Stimulate Hair Growth
description: You're a few zaps away from fuller, stronger hair.
excerpt: High frequency wands have recently gained popularity for their growth-inducing benefits. Here, ELLE.com found the seven best high frequency wands for stronger, healthier strands.
text: Best OverallStacked Skincare High Frequency Acne DeviceCredit: Courtesy of the brandsIt’s safe to say nearly every skin care obsessive loves Stacked Skincare or has the cult-favorite brand on their wishlist. The comb attachment promotes blood flow to the scalp to encourage growth.Includes: Pointy wand, mushroom wand, spoon wand, comb wandTreatment area: Face, scalp Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars An Amazon reviewer says: “I have had a thinning hairline for many years that I have been trying to regrow. Since using this device for about three weeks now, I can see fine baby hairs growing in. I think if you are consistent and follow the directions, you will have good, reliable results.” Best for Full Body Pure Daily Care NuDerma Clinical Skin Therapy WandCredit: Courtesy of the brandsProsTargets many areas of the bodyConsSome say the attachments are fragile Your Sunday reset routine doesn’t need to stop at skin care. Here’s a kit with six different wands to treat your scalp, face, neck, and beyond. The nine-pronged wand, in particular, glides across the scalp to stimulate the follicles to promote growth. Includes: Device, Tongue wand, spot wand, mushroom wand, rod wand, Y-shape wand, comb wandTreatment areas: Face, scalp, body Amazon rating: 4.3/5 stars An Amazon reviewer says: “Used this diligently twice a week for four years, and my skin looks better at 47 than it did four years ago. It’s also made a noticeable difference in hair thickness, and I know it can be attributed to the wand because when I use it, I get a lot more peach fuzz. Dermaplaning every few weeks takes care of that, though. Nutrition, skincare, and fitness are priorities for me, so the wand is far from the only thing keeping my skin in the best condition. However, if I miss a week or two of wand treatments, it is very noticeable, so I believe this is the single most impactful thing I do.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowBest for Small Spots Skin Gym High Frequency WandCredit: Courtesy of the brandsProsQuickly zaps impurities Designed specifically for pesky blemishes, these high frequency wands zap away impurities and prevent new ones from forming. Although the kit doesn’t come with a comb wand, the smaller options work just as well to target certain areas on the scalp or even as a treatment for thinning edges. Includes: Device, spoon electrode, dot-point electrode, mushroom electrodeTreatment areas: Face Nordstrom rating: 4.2/5 stars A Nordstrom reviewer says: “I just received mine and have used it twice. I love it. I even got a bonus attachment. It’s definitely worth $95! Try it!”Best AffordableQuiet&Far High Frequency Facial Machine Skin Care Devices Credit: Courtesy of the brandsProsEncourages hair growthAffordable and portable, this four-piece high frequency kit tackles stubborn breakouts, excessive hair fall, and everything in between. Includes: Device, mushroom wand, spoon wand, bend wand, comb wandTreatment areas: Face, scalp Amazon rating: 4.3/5 stars An Amazon reviewer says: “I moved to the USA two years ago and, of course, couldn’t bring my high frequency facial machine with me. So I bought a new one here in the USA. I got ridiculous hair loss because of the stress—this high frequency machine helps a lot. I use the comb nozzle for hair and the mushroom nozzle for pimples. This improves my hairline, and my hair looks thicker, healthier, and fuller. I definitely recommend this high frequency facial machine to those who suffer with hair loss and skin problems. It helps me a lot.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowBest for TravelElitzia Electrode Glass Tube Wand Credit: Courtesy of the brandsConsAttachment only, need to buy base device If hair growth is the only thing on your brain, skip the fluff and invest in this electrode wand attachment. The accessory is compact and light enough to travel with; it promotes blood circulation and stimulates the scalp to prevent hair shedding. Includes: Comb attachment Treatment area: Scalp Amazon rating: 4.2/5 stars An Amazon reviewer says: “Works so well and really makes your hair grow!!! I had some thinning, and it’s already filled in!”Best LED Light Therapy Comb HairMax Ultima 9 Classic LaserComb Hair Growth DeviceCredit: Courtesy of the brandsInstead of high frequency, this hair growth-stimulating device uses LED light and soothing bristles to minimize hair fall and boost growth for denser, fuller strands.Includes: Comb, base Treatment area: ScalpAmazon rating: 3.9/5 stars An Amazon reviewer says: “I’ve been using Hair Max combs for over 10 years now. They definitely work at staving off hair loss. You will also see some growth. If people aren’t getting results, they are probably doing it wrong, or they were dealt a bad hand in genetics.” Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowBest for BeginnersTumakou High Frequency Facial Wands Credit: Courtesy of the brandsThis kit uses blue light therapy, which kills bacteria and reduces inflammation, to treat all areas of your face and scalp. You have full control of intensity levels, but it’s best to start at the lowest and work your way up.Includes: Comb wand, mushroom wand, bend wand, tongue wandTreatment area: Face and scalp Amazon rating: 4.1/5 stars An Amazon reviewer says: “My wife and I had no previous experience or knowledge of this type of product, but I’m sure we’re glad we decided to give it a shot. I don’t know the exact science behind this product, but let me tell you—it works. My wife told me it had diminished the acne scars on her face. She also used the hair wand and told me that her hair feels softer and less coarse. My wife has basically taken this machine over, and I haven’t had a chance to try it yet. My wife gives it five stars.”Meet the ExpertsAnabel Kingsley is the London- and New York-based brand president and consultant trichologist at Philip Kingsley.Mandy Buechner is a California-based hair loss practitioner and certified trichologist.Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowIs a high frequency wand necessary for growing hair?When used with other growth-stimulating products and tools, high frequency wands can be a worthy addition to your hair care lineup. “A high-frequency wand is not strictly necessary for hair growth, but it can be a helpful tool in a broader hair care regimen. It can stimulate blood circulation to the scalp and improve scalp health, possibly supporting hair growth. However, results can vary, and it’s best used alongside other therapies and a healthy lifestyle,” Mandy Buechner explains. How often should you use a high frequency wand for hair growth? Like any skin care or hair treatment tool, it’s best to start a few times a week and titrate to a frequency that you can be consistent with. “ For optimal results, a high frequency wand for hair growth is typically recommended about two to three times a week. Each session can last around 10 to 15 minutes. Consistency is key, so integrating it into your hair care routine can enhance its benefits over time. Always follow the manufacturer’s guidelines and consult a professional if you have any concerns,” Buechner adds.Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowWhat's the difference between high-frequency and light therapy?When searching for treatment tools for your skin and hair, it’s important to know which ones cater best to your specific concerns. High frequency is an electrode applied to the skin and scalp that uses electrical current to stimulate the scalp. “The current creates a mild, therapeutic heat that can kill bacteria, reduce oil production, and improve skin texture,” Buechner says. However, light therapy is a more commonly used treatment in skin care and “uses specific wavelengths of light, such as LED (light-emitting diode) or laser, to target various skin issues like acne, pigmentation, wrinkles, and overall skin rejuvenation. Different wavelengths (like blue light for acne or red light for anti-aging) penetrate the skin at different levels, promoting healing, reducing inflammation, and stimulating collagen production,” she shares. Why Trust ELLE Beauty?As a leading publisher of fashion, lifestyle, and beauty content, ELLE.com is committed to highlighting the best products in various categories by personally testing the latest and most innovative products, interviewing countless experts, and vetting customer-loved items. For this piece, ELLE.com beauty commerce editor interviewed hair experts to learn about high frequency wands for hair growth and combed through customer reviews to find the best models. Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowShop More ELLE Beauty Essentials Nerisha Penrose is the Beauty Commerce Editor at ELLE.com. Prior to joining the team, she was an Editorial Fellow at ELLE.com. In her current role, she helps lead coverage on makeup, skin care, hair, and fragrances. With over six years of experience in the world of beauty editorial, Nerisha enjoys delving deep into the complexities of fragrance notes, hunting for the best fixes for acne-prone skin, and advocating for daily sunscreen use. She regularly researches and tests the latest products, consults beauty professionals (including our Beauty Advisory Board) to determine the best expert-approved formulas to recommend, and conducts interviews with luminaries across the industry. Nerisha received her bachelor’s degree in Communication and Media Studies from Temple University before joining the editorial teams at Nylon and Billboard. In 2020, she co-launched our popular franchise The State of Black Beauty, an ongoing exploration of—and destination for—beauty at the intersection of Black culture.
html:
Best Overall

Stacked Skincare High Frequency Acne Device

It’s safe to say nearly every skin care obsessive loves Stacked Skincare or has the cult-favorite brand on their wishlist. The comb attachment promotes blood flow to the scalp to encourage growth.

Includes: Pointy wand, mushroom wand, spoon wand, comb wand

Treatment area: Face, scalp

Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I have had a thinning hairline for many years that I have been trying to regrow. Since using this device for about three weeks now, I can see fine baby hairs growing in. I think if you are consistent and follow the directions, you will have good, reliable results.”

Best for Full Body

Pure Daily Care NuDerma Clinical Skin Therapy Wand

Pros
  • Targets many areas of the body
Cons
  • Some say the attachments are fragile

Your Sunday reset routine doesn’t need to stop at skin care. Here’s a kit with six different wands to treat your scalp, face, neck, and beyond. The nine-pronged wand, in particular, glides across the scalp to stimulate the follicles to promote growth.

Includes: Device, Tongue wand, spot wand, mushroom wand, rod wand, Y-shape wand, comb wand

Treatment areas: Face, scalp, body

Amazon rating: 4.3/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “Used this diligently twice a week for four years, and my skin looks better at 47 than it did four years ago. It’s also made a noticeable difference in hair thickness, and I know it can be attributed to the wand because when I use it, I get a lot more peach fuzz. Dermaplaning every few weeks takes care of that, though. Nutrition, skincare, and fitness are priorities for me, so the wand is far from the only thing keeping my skin in the best condition. However, if I miss a week or two of wand treatments, it is very noticeable, so I believe this is the single most impactful thing I do.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best for Small Spots

Skin Gym High Frequency Wand

Pros
  • Quickly zaps impurities

Designed specifically for pesky blemishes, these high frequency wands zap away impurities and prevent new ones from forming. Although the kit doesn’t come with a comb wand, the smaller options work just as well to target certain areas on the scalp or even as a treatment for thinning edges.

Includes: Device, spoon electrode, dot-point electrode, mushroom electrode

Treatment areas: Face

Nordstrom rating: 4.2/5 stars

A Nordstrom reviewer says: “I just received mine and have used it twice. I love it. I even got a bonus attachment. It’s definitely worth $95! Try it!”

Best Affordable

Quiet&Far High Frequency Facial Machine Skin Care Devices

Pros
  • Encourages hair growth

Affordable and portable, this four-piece high frequency kit tackles stubborn breakouts, excessive hair fall, and everything in between.

Includes: Device, mushroom wand, spoon wand, bend wand, comb wand

Treatment areas: Face, scalp

Amazon rating: 4.3/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I moved to the USA two years ago and, of course, couldn’t bring my high frequency facial machine with me. So I bought a new one here in the USA. I got ridiculous hair loss because of the stress—this high frequency machine helps a lot. I use the comb nozzle for hair and the mushroom nozzle for pimples. This improves my hairline, and my hair looks thicker, healthier, and fuller. I definitely recommend this high frequency facial machine to those who suffer with hair loss and skin problems. It helps me a lot.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best for Travel

Elitzia Electrode Glass Tube Wand

Cons
  • Attachment only, need to buy base device

If hair growth is the only thing on your brain, skip the fluff and invest in this electrode wand attachment. The accessory is compact and light enough to travel with; it promotes blood circulation and stimulates the scalp to prevent hair shedding.

Includes: Comb attachment

Treatment area: Scalp

Amazon rating: 4.2/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “Works so well and really makes your hair grow!!! I had some thinning, and it’s already filled in!”

Best LED Light Therapy Comb

HairMax Ultima 9 Classic LaserComb Hair Growth Device

Instead of high frequency, this hair growth-stimulating device uses LED light and soothing bristles to minimize hair fall and boost growth for denser, fuller strands.

Includes: Comb, base

Treatment area: Scalp

Amazon rating: 3.9/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I’ve been using Hair Max combs for over 10 years now. They definitely work at staving off hair loss. You will also see some growth. If people aren’t getting results, they are probably doing it wrong, or they were dealt a bad hand in genetics.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best for Beginners

Tumakou High Frequency Facial Wands

This kit uses blue light therapy, which kills bacteria and reduces inflammation, to treat all areas of your face and scalp. You have full control of intensity levels, but it’s best to start at the lowest and work your way up.

Includes: Comb wand, mushroom wand, bend wand, tongue wand

Treatment area: Face and scalp

Amazon rating: 4.1/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “My wife and I had no previous experience or knowledge of this type of product, but I’m sure we’re glad we decided to give it a shot. I don’t know the exact science behind this product, but let me tell you—it works. My wife told me it had diminished the acne scars on her face. She also used the hair wand and told me that her hair feels softer and less coarse. My wife has basically taken this machine over, and I haven’t had a chance to try it yet. My wife gives it five stars.”

Meet the Experts

Anabel Kingsley is the London- and New York-based brand president and consultant trichologist at Philip Kingsley.

Mandy Buechner is a California-based hair loss practitioner and certified trichologist.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Is a high frequency wand necessary for growing hair?

When used with other growth-stimulating products and tools, high frequency wands can be a worthy addition to your hair care lineup. “A high-frequency wand is not strictly necessary for hair growth, but it can be a helpful tool in a broader hair care regimen. It can stimulate blood circulation to the scalp and improve scalp health, possibly supporting hair growth. However, results can vary, and it’s best used alongside other therapies and a healthy lifestyle,” Mandy Buechner explains.

How often should you use a high frequency wand for hair growth?

Like any skin care or hair treatment tool, it’s best to start a few times a week and titrate to a frequency that you can be consistent with. “ For optimal results, a high frequency wand for hair growth is typically recommended about two to three times a week. Each session can last around 10 to 15 minutes. Consistency is key, so integrating it into your hair care routine can enhance its benefits over time. Always follow the manufacturer’s guidelines and consult a professional if you have any concerns,” Buechner adds.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

What's the difference between high-frequency and light therapy?

When searching for treatment tools for your skin and hair, it’s important to know which ones cater best to your specific concerns. High frequency is an electrode applied to the skin and scalp that uses electrical current to stimulate the scalp. “The current creates a mild, therapeutic heat that can kill bacteria, reduce oil production, and improve skin texture,” Buechner says. However, light therapy is a more commonly used treatment in skin care and “uses specific wavelengths of light, such as LED (light-emitting diode) or laser, to target various skin issues like acne, pigmentation, wrinkles, and overall skin rejuvenation. Different wavelengths (like blue light for acne or red light for anti-aging) penetrate the skin at different levels, promoting healing, reducing inflammation, and stimulating collagen production,” she shares.

Why Trust ELLE Beauty?

As a leading publisher of fashion, lifestyle, and beauty content, ELLE.com is committed to highlighting the best products in various categories by personally testing the latest and most innovative products, interviewing countless experts, and vetting customer-loved items. For this piece, ELLE.com beauty commerce editor interviewed hair experts to learn about high frequency wands for hair growth and combed through customer reviews to find the best models.

Nerisha Penrose is the Beauty Commerce Editor at ELLE.com. Prior to joining the team, she was an Editorial Fellow at ELLE.com. In her current role, she helps lead coverage on makeup, skin care, hair, and fragrances. With over six years of experience in the world of beauty editorial, Nerisha enjoys delving deep into the complexities of fragrance notes, hunting for the best fixes for acne-prone skin, and advocating for daily sunscreen use. She regularly researches and tests the latest products, consults beauty professionals (including our Beauty Advisory Board) to determine the best expert-approved formulas to recommend, and conducts interviews with luminaries across the industry. Nerisha received her bachelor’s degree in Communication and Media Studies from Temple University before joining the editorial teams at Nylon and Billboard. In 2020, she co-launched our popular franchise The State of Black Beauty, an ongoing exploration of—and destination for—beauty at the intersection of Black culture.
